answers.text:
Hi Mike,
Good question. The knowledge network has a ton of resources about sustainability. Those can be found here: http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/topic/253
Here’s something from the ICMA Center for Sustainable Communities that I think will help you. http://icma.org/en/results/sustainable_communities/resources/blogpost/2380/Sustainability_and_Incentives_Using_the_Triple_Bottom_Line_Tool
I hope I was able to help! 
Jesse Himes, Knowledge Network Intern, jhimes@icma.org

answers.author: David Wortman
answers.text:
If you're talking about indicators/performance measures in general, IISD has a great searchable resource: http://www.iisd.org/measure/compendium/searchinitiatives.aspx.  If you are talking about specific performance measures for a facility such as a building, how about using energy metrics like kbtu/square foot or energy cost/square foot to measure efficiency? If it's a high water user kgals or cost/sf could also be used. Hope this helps.
Dave Wortman, Brendle Group
www.brendlegroup.com

author: J. Munger
text:
I am trying to see if there are any other counties/cities that have implemented sustainability-related performance measures. We have a certain large county-owned facility that is requesting extra funds to operate and we are looking to incentivize those funds in the form of measures that could reduce overhead/operating costs. 
Thanks everybody, in advance!
title: Sustainability Performance Measures
